alert.note: Alert for Jeff Davis; Pecos; Reeves (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued March 14 at 2:43PM CDT until March 14 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northern Pecos County in southwestern Texas... Southern Reeves County in southwestern Texas... Northeastern Jeff Davis County in southwestern Texas... * Until 330 PM CDT. * At 241 PM CDT, a dust cloud along a cold front was located 15 miles northwest of Fort Stockton extending west to near Verhalen, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Less than one half mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 186 and 323. Interstate 20 between mile markers 0 and 16. Locations impacted include... Fort Stockton, Balmorhea, Balmorhea Lake, Balmorhea State Park, Saragosa, Fort Stockton-Pecos County Airport, Coyanosa, Bakersfield, Verhalen, Toyahvale, Firestone Test Track, B F Goodrich Testing Track and Imperial Reservoir. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
